Now, code in C:

First, include headers: We need stdio, and stdlib for malloc. Also, since dynamic arrays are used.

So,

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

Then, the main function:

int main() {

    int N;
    long M;
    scanf("%d %ld", &N, &M); // Read N and M first.

    // Allocate H array
    long *H = (long *) malloc(N * sizeof(long));
    // Allocate ans array (integers, 0 or 1)
    int *ans = (int *) malloc(N * sizeof(int));

    for (int i =0; i < N; i++) {
        scanf("%ld", &H[i]);
        ans[i] = 1; // true initial value
    }

    for (long i =0; i < M; i++) {
        int a, b;
        scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);
        int x = a-1, y = b-1;
        if (H[x] < H[y]) {
            ans[x] =0;
        } else if (H[x] > H[y]) {
            ans[y] =0;
        } else {
            ans[x]=0;
            ans[y] =0;
        }
    }

    int count =0;
    for (int i=0; i<N; i++) {
        if (ans[i]) count++;
    }

    printf("%d\n", count);

    free(H);
    free(ans);

    return 0;
}

Ah, that's a big issue. In Java's long is 64-bit, and in the code, H is stored as Java's long which is equivalent to C's 'long long'. 

Therefore, the array H must be of type 'long long' rather than 'long' in C. 

Thus, in the C code:

Therefore, correcting:

In the C code:

Instead of 'long' for H's type, use 'long long'.

So the code should be:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    int N;
    long long M;
    scanf("%d %lld", &N, &M); // Use %lld for long long.

    long long *H = (long long *)malloc(N * sizeof(long long));
    int *ans = (int *)malloc(N * sizeof(int));

    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        scanf("%lld", &H[i]);
        ans[i] = 1;
    }

    for (long long i = 0; i < M; i++) {
        int a, b;
        scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);
        int x = a-1, y = b-1;
        if (H[x] < H[y]) {
            ans[x] = 0;
        } else if (H[x] > H[y]) {
            ans[y] = 0;
        } else {
            ans[x] = 0;
            ans[y] = 0;
        }
    }

    int count = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        if (ans[i]) count++;
    }

    printf("%d\n", count);
    free(H);
    free(ans);
    return 0;
}
